pl.net.yuri.magister.soap.util
Class Util

java.lang.Object
  pl.net.yuri.magister.soap.util.Util

public class Util
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class used for caching information needed during application runtime, like:

  • Allegro Web API session identifier
  • Allegro Web API server time
  • Allegro Web API user identifier
  • Allegro Web API country code
  • Allegro Web API component versions
  • Allegro Web API key
Contains also utility methods for various tasks, like:
  • Encoding password for Allegro Web API
  • Resizing table columns
  • Getting information on command line parameters
  • Centering frames and dialogs on screen

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jerzy Czopek

addStatusTypeForCountry

public static void addStatusTypeForCountry(int countryCode,
                                           SysStatusType status)
Puts given status for given country into cache for later use.

Parameters:
countryCode - country code which status is added to cache
status - status object with all component version for given country

getStatusTypeForCountry

public static SysStatusType getStatusTypeForCountry(int countryCode)
Returns SysStatusType from cache for given country. Returned object contains component versions of Allegro Web API for given country.

Parameters:
countryCode - country code
Returns:
proper SysStatusType if country present in cache, null otherwise

setPreferredTableColumnWidths

public static void setPreferredTableColumnWidths(javax.swing.JTable table,
                                                 double[] percentages)
Resize columns of given table. New column widths are passed in array od doubles, which represent new column width in percentages, where 0.0 is 0% and 1.0 is 100% of total table width.

Parameters:
table - which table columns resize
percentages - new widths of columns in percentages
Throws:
java.lang.Error - if table column count is different than element count in percentages array

getCommandLineParameters

public static org.apache.commons.cli.Options getCommandLineParameters()
Returns options available as command line arguments. They are used to parse command line arguments and display help.

command line options arguments
